給職場新鮮人(https://richardlu0952.blogspot.com/2021/12/blog-post.html)
認識金融保險機構的經營與管理-從事金融業最基本的知識與概念(https://richardlu0952.blogspot.com/2022/02/blog-post.html)
readings: 如何過著幸福快樂(Happiness)的人生 - 正向心理學(Positive Phychology)的觀點(https://richardlu0952.blogspot.com/2023/08/happiness-positive-phychology.html)
weeklyScds: Reading: 課程簡介： 本課程旨在幫助學生瞭解企業實習的重要性以及如何在實習期間獲得寶貴的經驗和技能。學生將學習如何有效地尋找、申請和選擇實習機會，並掌握在職場環境中所需的基本素養和職業倫理。課程將結合理論與實踐，幫助學生在實際經驗中成長和發展。 課程目標： 瞭解企業實習的目的和價值，並能解釋如何運用實習經驗來發展職業生涯。 掌握有效的實習尋找和申請策略，包括撰寫優秀的履歷和求職信。 培養在職場中所需的基本溝通技巧，包括書面和口頭溝通。 學習如何建立良好的專業形象，包括著裝、舉止和態度。 理解職業倫理和職業道德的重要性，並能在職場中遵循適當的行為準則。 發展解決問題和適應變化的能力&l | Learning: 資訊倫理與生成式AI應用概念 | Assignment: 履歷製作 || Reading: 理解職業倫理和職業道德的重要性 | Assignment: 職業倫理和職業道德作業 || Reading: 有效的實習尋找和申請策略 | Assignment: 申請策略 || Reading: 職場中所需的基本溝通技巧 | Assignment: 基本溝通技巧 || Reading: 解決問題和適應變化 | Assignment: 解決問題和適應變化 || Reading: 著裝、舉止和態度 | Assignment: 著裝、舉止和態度 || Reading: 書面和口頭溝通 | Assignment: 書面和口頭溝通

integrity:
一、期中 (20分)：依體適能系統給分，兩項在全校大一後10%，需完成「體適能諮商輔導」及「補救教學3次」，無故未參加者本項0分。
 
二、期末 (40分)：
     1. 游泳與水上救生能力 20分
     2. 足球測驗：10分
     3. 體適能課堂作業：10分
 
三、平時 (40分) (平時成績為下列項目之加總)
    1. 出席與課堂表現：依班級整體與個人表現給分
    2. 遲到 -0.5~2；事病假-2~10分每多一次多扣一分，滿6次平時成績0分。曠課扣1/3平時成績；不告而別平時成績0分。
       ***缺席請以學校系統請假，並依學校規定時程處理，未完成請假記為曠課
    3. 游泳課不下水：
      (1) 生理期每月一次，需完成當日課堂觀察報告。
      (2) 因身體因素不能下水需出示證明，可以課堂報告替代，本學期限一次。
      (3) 未繳交報告或超過限制次數記為請假扣分。
    4. 「總缺席6次」、「曠課3次」、「不告而別」平時成績0分，不接受加分，本學期不通過。
 

四、運動參與加分 (最高+20)
   1. 規律運動紀錄 (參閱ilearn資料)。
   2. 其他賽事視狀況給分，證明文件放入規律運動。
   3. 全校拔河賽+5分。
   4. 游泳加強班：每一次上課+1分
   ¤ 曠課、不告而別之扣分不得以加分項加回。

description: 本課程旨在培養學生對全球金融市場、金融機構運作、投資與風險管理、保險、精算與金融科技的核心概念，並探討金融科技、永續金融與產業創新的影響。透過企業參訪、案例分析與專題討論，學生將全面認識金融學院三大領域的發展與應用，為未來職涯選擇奠定堅實基礎。
targets:
了解金融市場與機構運作，掌握投資工具與風險管理基礎
透過案例分析與問題導向學習，學習跨領域整合與解決問題能力的知識

description: 讓學生從經濟學的課程中瞭解經濟體系中的消費者、生產者、及政府單位如何在有限制的條件下做選擇。將理論的邏輯推理運用在日常生活當中。
targets:
理解基本的經濟問題，供需原理，價格機能的運作及相關實例之應用。
理解市場失靈之原因及其對策。
理解廠商的生產及成本函數。
理解不同的市場結構，及廠商的訂價行為。

description: 演練內容包含函數極限，導數，導函數，微分公式，鏈鎖律，隱微分，高階導數，線性近似與微分量，極大和極小值，導數與函數圖形之關係，無窮極限，水平漸近線，反導數，定積分，微積分基本定理，不定積分，代換法，曲線所圍之區域面積，自然對數函數，自然指數函數，一般對數與指數函數，反三角函數等。
targets:
理解單變數實數值函數之極限、連續、導數及積分定義，並建立相關定理，從中訓練學生邏輯分析能力。
理解基本函數極限、連續、導數及積分之運算規則，並使學生熟練運算技巧。
應用微積分理論及運算技巧處理相關幾何問題及極大極小值問題等，並為經濟學與物理學等跨領域學習作準備。

description: 本課程旨在培養學生進入金融職場所需的專業技能與實務應用能力，涵蓋金融文書處理、商業簡報製作、職場溝通技巧、專案管理與數據分析，並透過模擬實戰與案例分析，提升學生的職場競爭力。此外，課程將導入企業參訪與業界專家分享，幫助學生了解職場文化與金融產業的最新趨勢，為未來就業與實習奠定基礎。
targets:
透過實務練習與模擬，提高學生在金融產業中的溝通與談判技巧
提升學生對金融產業的職場適應能力，強化職場倫理與專業形象
textBooks:
模組一：金融職場認識與職涯規劃（探索導向）




《The Personal MBA》（Josh Kaufman）


金管會「金融職涯探索資源」、CFA職涯指南


職涯中心測評工具與校內諮詢活動搭配


模組二：職場通用技能與實戰練習（實務導向）


《商業簡報力》（Nancy Duarte）


《HBR Guide to Making Every Meeting Matter》

description: This course presents several basic statistical techniques which are frequently used by managers to students. Some relatively simple practical examples will be provided to students for practicing these techniques. Students may need a laptop with Microsoft Excel to perform the calculations associated with these statistical techniques. Students will know how to analyze and interpret the results and the output from Excel.
targets:
Apply Excel to describe and analyse information through numerical and also graphical procedures
Obtain knowledge of probable conclusions about population values through statistical inferences.
Comprehension- Estimate and test hypotheses using probability theory and distributions.
Explore and analyse the relationships between variables and learn to predict values of strategic variables by regression and correlation analysis

description:
Focusing on the price impacts of consumer and firm in markets, the key microeconomic concepts and analytical techniques are introduced in this course. The students will also be exposed to various economic issues. 

Having reinforced their appreciation of microeconomics in theory and in practice, students will be able to contemplate on the market interactions between producers and consumers, and in turn develop the ability to analyze the pros and cons of government intervention.
targets:
Comprehension of microeconomic concepts and theories
Application - Ability to recognize costs that firms confront
Comprehending of issues related to market structures
Knowledge - Appreciation of market failures and government intervention
textBooks: Mankiw, N. Gregory. Principles of Economics, 9th Edition, Cengage Learning, 2020. ISBN:978-981-49-1534-2

description: Learning the fundamental concepts and frameworks of innovation is just as important as getting hands-on experience. This course will cover the basic concepts of innovation, basic theories, and representative practical cases. Topics will include, but are not limited to, types of innovation, design thinking, business models, and social innovation. The purpose is to equip attendants with basic innovation tools, while having a preliminary experience with these tools through the course project. The project also aims to draw attendants’ attention to creating social impact through innovation.
targets:
Recognise and understand the characteristics of incremental and radical innovation
Comprehend different innovation processes
Develop a global perspective of critical social challenges
Learn to effectively employ design research methods and tools
Develop an ability to analyse the desirability, feasibility and viability of a proposed innovation
Collaborate effectively with team members and innovation stakeholders
Clearly communicate the rationale for a proposed innovation project.
textBooks:
There is no official textbook. 
However, materails will be gathered related to creativity and innovation.
readings: Simple articles, papers, creative techniuqes and tools, and Harvard case will be used.

description:
This course is designed to help students compose great essays. By focusing on various styles of writing, we offer a wide range of support to improve your skills in a multitude of genres, including discursive, analytical, and narrative works, which are essential to all academics and professionals. 

Through the proper use of these skills, students will be able to organize and write very cohesively, paying particular attention to the following five criteria:  thesis/focus, organization, content/development, syntax/diction, and mechanics/grammar.  

Throughout the course, students must write at least three essays, each of which the instructor shall grade with both written comments and verbal feedback.

The design of this course shall enhance your writing capability to a standard that should match all college students at home and abroad. The core skills gained herein will solidify your future progress both in academia and in other professions.
targets:
construct sentences with accuracy, variety, and clarity;
organize individual paragraphs and entire essays
use within an essay supporting material drawn from primary and secondary sources, including appropriate citations
perform effectively the essential steps of the writing process (prewriting, organizing, composing, revising, and editing
use appropriate diction and tone

description: To succeed in managing your money and investing for the long-term, you need to have strong financial and investment literacy. This course provides the materials for students to learn and practice the fundamentals of wealth management through investments. Students will learn the fundamentals, build your financial literacy, and form a basic financial plan in class. This course is not a replacement for core foundational courses in finance and investments. Rather this course is focused on the narrow, practical objective of building fundamental financial and investment literacy, so as to begin the life-long practice of learning and investing as a college student. There are multiple performance evaluation for this class: weekly assignments, mid-term oral-presentation, and final project report.
targets:
1.	Broad understanding of the global wealth management industry, current trends, and ethical considerations
2.	Build financial and investment literacy – the ability to understand and use financial and investment skills
3.	Ability to apply fundamental financial and investment skills
4.	Ability to build a personal financial plan and investing approach

description: Marketing Management is one of the fundamental courses for business studies. This course introduces various Marketing concepts and their applications in business-to-consumer, business-to-business, and not-for-profit situations. You will also study how marketing works in practice and gain hands-on experience by applying these Marketing concepts in your semester project.
targets:
Delivering the fundamental Marketing concepts
Giving attendants hands-on experience in using these marketing concepts
Using Generative AI tools in practice
textBooks: Kotler, P., Keller, K.L. & Chernev, A. (2022) Marketing Management, 16e (Global Edition), Harlow, England: Pearson (e-version)
readings: For your information: You might check academic journals such as Journal of Marketing, Journal of Academy of Marketing Science, Journal of Consumer Research and other marketing academic publications.
Softwares: [{'soft_name': 'Microsoft Copilot 365, ChatGTP, Canva (slides and multimedia content), or other software helping you', 'soft_memo': 'You will need the software for your classroom discussions, presentations, and semester project.'}]
weeklyScds: Reading: Introduction of the course Introduction to Marketing | Learning: 1.Deciding groups for the semester project. 2. Deciding the product/brand for the semester project. 3. Researching the product/brand you want to redesign and find out more about the company selling this product/service || Reading: Mid-Autumn festival | Learning: No class. || Reading: Marketing planning and management | Learning: Market environment analysis, SWOT analysis for the chosen brand. || Reading: Conducting marketing research | Learning: Deciding the market research methods your group uses for the semester project. || Reading: Analyzing consumer markets | Learning: Design for survey and interview questions. || Reading: Analyzing business markets | Learning: To be announced (pending: online observation for international B2B companies) || Reading: Identifying market segments and target customers, Crafting a customer value proposition and positioning | Learning: Deciding your target market, based on the exercise results in the previous weeks. || Reading: Designing and managing products | Learning: Based on the decision in the previous week, redesign the product/services your group want to offer. || Reading: November 05:Mid semester presentation | Learning: For the assessed mid-semester presentation (15%), you need to present your chosen product/brand (give an introduction of the company and the product), whether it is for a B2C or B2B market, the market research method, and reworked STP. Detailed to be announced || Reading: Designing and managing services | Learning: Consider what extra services you might offer for the reworked product/service || Reading: Building strong brands, building customer loyalty | Learning: Consider how you might strengthen the brand of your product, and how you might build customer loyalty for it. || Reading: Managing pricing and sales promotions | Learning: Consider how much you want to charge for this reworked product and the sales promotion (price incentives) you want to use for promoting this brand. || Reading: Managing marketing communications, direct marketing | Learning: Design a marketing communications program for promoting your brand, such as which marketing channels, what kind of content you will use for each channel etc. The focus here is more on traditional marketing channels. || Reading: The integrated marketing campaign in the digital age | Learning: Design a marketing communications program for promoting your brand, such as which marketing channels, what kind of content you will use for each channel etc. The focus here is more on digital marketing channels. || Reading: Designing and managing distribution channels, Managing retailing | Learning: Design the distribution channels and retail outlets for your reworked product/brand. || Reading: Tapping into Global Markets | Learning: Exam drill for the final exam. (At the same time, you need to finish up your semester project presentation) || Reading: Social responsibility marketing | Learning: Final exam in the third hour (multiple choice and simple essay question) || Reading: January 07 2025 Final presentation | Learning: For the assessed final presentation (35%), you need to present a project summary showing the whole redeveloped marketing plan for the chosen product/brand. Details to be announced. || || || || || || || || || || || || || || || || || ||

description: Critical thinking is the use of reasoning to determine what is true and what is false. Accordingly, critical thinking is a valuable skill utilised in all disciplines and professions. This Critical Thinking course aims to empower students to think more clearly, insightfully and analytically about what they believe, and be more effective in arguing their views. Students will develop the ability to recognise and avoid common barriers to critical thinking; develop strategies for evaluating evidence and arguments, and learn to formulate and make sound arguments.
targets:
Understanding critical issues of contemporary world
Develop the ability to articulate and discuss critical issues
Develop the ability to organize information and build an argument

description:
The aim of this course is to foster students’ ability for effective integration of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) and business operations and formulate solutions that fulfill the needs of business. 
Students will obtain the skill to build models through the use of database, web and spreadsheet technologies and to apply business data in presentations.
targets:
Satisfy client's needs through data analysis.
Create business solutions supported by relevant information
Resolve business related issues through information technology.
Professionally convey findings to supervisors.

description: 了解創新的本質、類型、挑戰與重要性，以及如何能規劃創新成為企業策略驅動主力，並有效執行。探討創新於企業內之落實與外部環境之影響因子，以進一步引導學生進行創新專案之規劃、設計與評估。並且透過問題意識的建立與專案規劃與評估技巧，引導學生將組織內不同形式之創新，例如「技術創新、產品創新、策略創新、流程創新、服務創新與管理創新」，融入企業經營的策略與產業發展脈絡。
targets:
Describe and comprehend the innovation process from a management perspective, including the roles of knowledge and of people within a collaborative network.
Explain the process involved in effectively managing creativity and apply this knowledge to their own creative idea or innovation context.
Explain the relationship between creativity, knowledge and innovation and how it impacts business growth, sustainability and value creation
Evaluate the characteristics that make innovative organisations successful and discuss how a business might emulate these traits.
Oversee and evaluate strengths and weaknesses of a product/service development process in an entrepreneurial context and improve its effectiveness, utility, and competitiveness.

description: Topics include an overview/ review and extension of basic statistics, followed by an introduction to simple and multiple linear regression. Estimation and hypothesis testing are examined at an intuitive level using simulations as well as at a practical and theoretical level. Additional topics may include binary regression and instrumental variables. Students will be heavily exposed to EXcel.
targets:
Be able to comprehend basic regression concepts and tools.
Be able to apply regression analysis, including data transformations, diagnostic checking, model selection and validation.

description: This course is designed to develop public speaking skills . Public speaking is a vital soft skill - be it used in the classroom or for a presentation at work . Attention will also be given to individual communication activities designed to improve the ability to organize , reason tically , and to listen effectively . Each student will develop and deliver several speeches and participate in peer evaluations.
targets:
Improve your English vocabulary level.
 Improve your overall English proficiency level, particularly speaking.
Effectively research, type, and present your speech topic in front of a small or large group of people (target audience), particularly your classmates and instructor (myself), by first attaining (and then maintaining) a high degree of articulation, awareness, confidence, and expression.
 Be able to persuade a large percentage of your target audience to concur with your viewpoint(s) that you are sharing with them.
 Actively participate with fellow classmates in in-class group activities for the purpose of having a greater chance of achieving the 4 aforementioned goals.
textBooks:
Public Speaking: Concepts and Skills for a Diverse Society, Eighth Edition.


Publisher ‏ : ‎ Cengage Learning; 8th edition (January 1, 2015)
Language ‏ : ‎ English
Paperback ‏ : ‎ 352 pages
ISBN-10 ‏ : ‎ 1285445856

description: This course is designed to develop public speaking skills . Public speaking is a vital soft skill - be it used in the classroom or for a presentation at work . Attention will also be given to individual communication activities designed to improve the ability to organize , reason tically , and to listen effectively . Each student will develop and deliver several speeches and participate in peer evaluations.
targets:
Improve your English vocabulary level.
 Improve your overall English proficiency level, particularly speaking.
Effectively research, type, and present your speech topic in front of a small or large group of people (target audience), particularly your classmates and instructor (myself), by first attaining (and then maintaining) a high degree of articulation, awareness, confidence, and expression.
 Be able to persuade a large percentage of your target audience to concur with your viewpoint(s) that you are sharing with them.
 Actively participate with fellow classmates in in-class group activities for the purpose of having a greater chance of achieving the 4 aforementioned goals.

description:
Calculus is a course provides basic training in mathematics. It involves the differentiation and the integration. These are used to solve problems via geometry and algebra. Calculus has a lot of
applications in many fields, such as science, business, economics and management. The materials in Calculus for Business and Aviation include the functions and graphs, limits of functions, the derivatives, the integrals, the partial differentiation
targets:
Understand the definition of the functions and graphs
Understand the limits of functions and be able to compute the limits by applying basic formulas.
Understand the definition of the derivatives and be able to compute the derivatives via basic properties
Be able to apply the derivatives to analyze the monotonicity and concavity of functions
Be able to apply the derivatives to solve the maximum and minimum problems
Realize the concept of the integrals and be able to apply fundamental theorem of calculus to compute the integrals
Be able to use a definite integral to obtain the area of the region between curves
Be able to find the derivatives of logarithmic, exponential and trigonometric functions
Understand the partial derivatives and be able to compute the partial derivatives via basic Properties

description:
Focusing on the price impacts of consumer and firm in markets, the key microeconomic concepts and analytical techniques are introduced in this course. The students will also be exposed to various economic issues. 

Having reinforced their appreciation of microeconomics in theory and in practice, students will be able to contemplate on the market interactions between producers and consumers, and in turn develop the ability to analyze the pros and cons of government intervention.
targets:
1.	Comprehension of microeconomic concepts and theories
2.	Application - Ability to recognize costs that firms confront
3. Comprehending of issues related to market structures
Knowledge - Appreciation of market failures and government intervention

description: This course introduces the basic accounting principles and concepts. Its aim is to let students know that accounting is an information and measurement system, which can help us to make better decisions and plans. The main contents include: the accounting cycle, merchandising accounting, cash, receivables, inventories, plant assets, liabilities, corporation accounting, cash flow analyses and financial statement analysis.

description: Critical thinking is the use of reasoning to determine what is true and what is false. Accordingly, critical thinking is a valuable skill utilised in all disciplines and professions. This Critical Thinking course aims to empower students to think more clearly, insightfully and analytically about what they believe, and be more effective in arguing their views. Students will develop the ability to recognise and avoid common barriers to critical thinking; develop strategies for evaluating evidence and arguments, and learn to formulate and make sound arguments.

description: Learning the fundamental concepts and frameworks of innovation is just as important as getting hands-on experience. This course will cover the basic concepts of innovation, basic theories, and representative practical cases. Topics will include, but are not limited to, types of innovation, design thinking, business models, and social innovation. The purpose is to equip attendants with basic innovation tools, while having a preliminary experience with these tools through the course project. The project also aims to draw attendants’ attention to creating social impact through innovation.
targets:
1.Analyze an existing product, system, or service, and suggest a feasible and purposeful innovation.
2.Critique outcomes to determine whether the resulting product, system, or service is a desirable market offering and a viable business proposition.

description:
Historical and political processes shaping U.S. culture, institutions, and society from before European expansion to the Civil War. Focus on the roles of workers, immigrants, and people of color from a comparative perspective. GE Area: D2 Note: Must complete the entire sequence (AAS 33A and 33B) to satisfy U.S. History, U.S. Constitution and California Government (US 1, 2, 3)
The purpose of the course is to examine the historical and political development of the United States from a multicultural perspective. The course will examine the principle events, developments, and problems of the United States from before the era of European expansion through the Civil War, emphasizing the role of class, race, ethnicity, and gender in American history and politics. Since Asian immigrants did not arrive in large numbers until the 1050s, AAS33A will focus on the historical experiences of African Americans, European Americans, Hispanic Americans, and Native Americans, while also noting how gender and sexuality affected the experiences of individuals within these diverse ethnoracial groups. Such an examination of ethnic groups in the United States will help us understand the development of this country as a diverse, multicultural nation.
targets:
Students will be able to place contemporary developments in cultural, historical, environmental, and spatial contexts.
Students will be able to identify the dynamics of ethnic, cultural gender/sexual, age-based, class, regional, national, transnational, and global identities and the similarities, differences, linkages, and interactions between them.
Students will be able to evaluate social science information, draw on different points of view, and formulate applications appropriate to contemporary social issues.
Students will be able to compare and contrast two or more ethnic groups, cultures, regions, nations, or social systems.
Students will be able to apply multidisciplinary material to a topic relevant to policy and social action at the local, national, and/or international levels.

description: Through the advanced development of information techniques, databases provide an important link for business programming and analysis. Students will learn about database management, database applications, structured programming language, and database contents for business analyses through the introduction of database types, linkages among data, and elementary programming languages such as SQL (Structured Query Language). Students will be able to program using either SAS or R programming language to solve business problems. Students will work on final projects to demonstrate how those computer programming languages can present business solutions.
targets:
To become familiar with the concept of operation, structure, and design of business databases.
To understand the applicable items and programming languages for extracting data from databases.
To employ the applications of merging data and statistical analysis on databases.

學期成績記分法

出席及缺席
登記為曠課者，曠課一次扣平時成績 5 個百分比分數 。學生請假依本校學生請假辦法辦理，務必要在上課之前，檢附請假理由及文件，線上提出申請。若不在申請期限內完成請假作業者，無充分的理由，經核准不得取消扣分。


課堂互動與參與討論作業
每位學生每週上iLearn 課程討論區，針對當次練習作業進行作答，作答完簽名得分。


作業提交及遲交
每次作業延遲一天則扣分5％。若您能提前通知我，並附上說明和預計完成的時間，我將酌情考量展延繳交作業時間的請求，若理由不充分不會批准請求。用iLearn提交作業，書面資料要使用Microsoft Office/Word、Excel、PowerPoint進行撰寫。


考評及補考
應參加考試之學生，未遵守請假或請假未經核准，而未參加考試者，該科該次考試成績以零分計算。


作弊及抄襲
違反此規則者，該次評核“不計分”或課程“不計分”。如有替考情事，其舞弊之雙方，均依逢甲大學學生獎懲辦法相關規定處理。


加分及補救措施
如果您發現學期出現困難時，如跟不上學習進度、聽不懂、或作業有問題等，請您儘早與老師聯繫，以便幫助您找到解決方案。


學期預警
當我發現您的學習進度跟不上、可能會妨礙學業成功之疑慮時，我可能會發出預警訊息給您、及您的學習導師。如果您收到預警通知，則您有責任盡快與我聯繫，討論學習上問題，將透過諮詢方式，給予您可能的協助。

description: This course is an introduction to physics. The main emphasis will be on the branch of physics known as mechanics. This is the study of motion and the causes of motion through the applications of fundamental principles of physics. We begin with kinematics, the quantitative description of the motion of particles. We then build on kinematics to learn how and why motion occurs, through the application of  Newton's laws of dynamics. Many examples will be considered as we explore the properties of specific forces and the details of the motion they bring about. The next step will be to describe physical processes in terms of energy and momentum, quantities that are always "conserved." Conservation laws allow us to solve problems in mechanics that would be very difficult by other techniques and provide a powerful approach to the analysis of physical systems in general. We then will extend our understanding of motion to the kinematics and dynamics of rotation. Finally, we will briefly study some of the physical properties of solids and fluids.
targets:
Provide the student with a clear and logical presentation of the basic concepts and principles of physics.
To strengthen concept understanding through a range of interesting applications to the real world.

description: This course focuses the acquisition of basic communicative structures—vocabulary, correct pronunciation, and writing—within a relevant cultural context. The course aims to enable student communication in the target language as quickly as possible. Therefore, instruction will be conducted almost exclusively in Spanish. Students are expected to participate in all class activities and complete homework assignments designed to develop reading and writing skills. Students will be evaluated according to their progress in the five areas: speaking, oral comprehension, reading, writing, and knowledge of the cultures that speak Spanish.

This course is an introduction to physics. The main emphasis will be on the branch of physics known as mechanics. This is the study of motion and the causes of motion through the applications of fundamental principles of physics. We begin with kinematics, the quantitative description of the motion of particles. We then build on kinematics to learn how and why motion occurs, through the application of Newton's laws of dynamics. Many examples will be considered as we explore the properties of specific forces and the details of the motion they bring about. The next step will be to describe physical processes in terms of energy and momentum, quantities that are always "conserved." Conservation laws allow us to solve problems in mechanics that would be very difficult by other techniques and provide a powerful approach to the analysis of physical systems in general. We then will extend our understanding of motion to the kinematics and dynamics of rotation. Finally, we will briefly study some of the physical properties of solids and fluids.
targets:
Capability to understand most of natural phenomena in physics science with a few fundamental principles and laws of physics associated with dynamics and thermal physics
Ability to systematically approach problems behaving from microscopically to macroscopically, such as the evolution from classical dynamics to quantized atomic systems, or the leading from mechanics to basic thermodynamics
Capability to describe topics of natural phenomena graphically and numerically by way of computer simulations using Easy Java Simulation and Matlab, without intensive training in Mathematics and Programming
Experience to perform simple physical and virtual experiments, using computers and a variety of physics apparatus, including the gathering, interpretation and analysis of experimental data.

description: The goal of this course is to teach students basic concepts of computer software and hardware in Engineering. The course will focus on data representation in computers and problem solving using computers and structured programming constructs. Students will practice program design in C programming language as part of a technical team
targets:
To understand the basic concepts of software and hardware
To design solutions for introductory level problems using appropriate design methodology incorporating elementary programming constructs in C programming
To understand the data types, control structures, and array usage related to C programming language
To read, analyze and explain introductory level C programs
To understand the definition of algorithms, code, document, debug, and problem-solving methods
To understand various programming languages, the effects of the state-of-the-art issues and engineering techniques on environments or society.

description: This course is designed to develop public speaking skills . Public speaking is a vital soft skill - be it used in the classroom or for a presentation at work . Attention will also be given to individual communication activities designed to improve the ability to organize , reason tically , and to listen effectively . Each student will develop and deliver several speeches and participate in peer evaluations.
targets:
Improve your English vocabulary level.
Improve your overall English proficiency level, particularly speaking.
Effectively research, type, and present your speech topic in front of a small or large group of people (target audience), particularly your classmates and instructor (myself), by first attaining (and then maintaining) a high degree of articulation, awareness, confidence, and expression.
Be able to persuade a large percentage of your target audience to concur with your viewpoint(s) that you are sharing with them.
Actively participate with fellow classmates in in-class group activities for the purpose of having a greater chance of achieving the 4 aforementioned goals.
textBooks:
Jaffe: Public Speaking: Concepts and Skills for a Diverse Society
Textbook encouraged but optional

https://www.americanrhetoric.com/

description: General chemistry is a course that involving chemical theory, chemical properties of matters, analyzing methods, and related applications. The content includes atomic theory, quantum theory, atomic structure, electron configuration, chemical bonding, molecular shape, together with major chemical reaction and thermochemistry. It helps the students to solve the problems logically and learn the knowledge for industrial applications.

General chemistry is a course that involving chemical theory, chemical properties of matters, analyzing methods, and related applications. The content includes atomic theory, quantum theory, atomic structure, electron configuration, chemical bonding, molecular shape, together with major chemical reaction and thermochemistry. It helps the students to solve the problems logically and learn the knowledge for industrial applications. General chemistry  seminar  is a supplemental part of General chemistry. During seminar you will be discussing some experiment and data analysis.

Improvement of general chemistry
Facilitating the connection between lecture and laboratory
Improving analysis skill in general chemistry

description: Learning the fundamental concepts and frameworks of innovation is just as important as getting hands-on experience. This course will cover the basic concepts of innovation, basic theories, and representative practical cases. Topics will include, but are not limited to, types of innovation, design thinking, business models, and social innovation. The purpose is to equip attendants with basic innovation tools, while having a preliminary experience with these tools through the course project. The project also aims to draw attendants’ attention to creating social impact through innovation.
targets:
be able to analyse an electrical product and suggest a feasible innovation
be able to comprehend whether the resulting product is a desirable marketing offering  and a viable business proposition

description:
Calculus is a course provides basic training in mathematics. It involves the differentiation and the integration. These are used to solve problems via geometry and algebra. Calculus has a lot of
applications in many fields, such as science, engineering, economics and management. The materials in Analytic Geometry and Calculus I include the limits of functions, the derivatives, the integrals, the logarithmic  and exponential functions, and the inverse trigonometric functions
targets:
Understand the limits of functions and be able to compute the limits by applying basic formulas
Understand the definition of the derivatives and be able to compute the derivatives via basic properties
Be able to apply the derivatives to analyze the monotonicity and concavity of functions
Be able to apply the derivatives to solve the maximum and minimum problems
Realize the concept of the integrals and be able to apply fundamental theorem of calculus to compute the integrals
Be able to use a definite integral to obtain the area of the region between curves
Be able to find the derivatives of logarithmic, exponential and inverse trigonometric functions

description: This course serves as an introduction to the major pre-Modern artistic traditions of India, China, and Japan. It is organized into three units that focus on the art and architecture of India, China, and Japan respectively. Each unit is structured chronologically. Unit 1 examines Indian Art from the Indus Valley Civilization through the art of the Mughal Empire, focusing on Buddhist, Hindu, and Islamic art and architecture. Unit 2 covers the arts of China from the Shang Dynasty through the Qing Dynasty, detailing the interaction between art, politics, and culture throughout Chinese dynastic history. Unit 3 introduces Japanese Art from the Jomon Period through the Edo Period, exploring the effects that various sub-traditions and sub-cultures (Tang Dynasty China, Buddhism, and the warrior class) had on the art of Japan. After completing this course, you will have a comprehensive understanding of the arts and architecture of pre-Modern India, China, and Japan and their relationship to the history and culture of their respective times and places.
targets:
Comprehend major pre-modern Indian, Chinese, and Japanese works of art and architecture
Comprehend the major art historical time periods in India, China, Japan and the important artistic developments that occurred during each of them
Knowing how art and architecture can be used to understand the politics, history, and culture of India, China, and Japan
Analyze, and compare and contrast different types of Asian art
Knowing fundamental hands-on project-based research method including object study, data-based cataloging, and basic curatorship

description: The course meets for approximately 72 hours during a 18-week semester. Successful completion of the course merits 4 semester hours of credit. The schedule outlined below allows time for two midterm exams plus a cumulative final exam, which are the norms for this course.
targets:
To understand the limits of functions and be able to verify the existence of limits
To understand and calculate partial derivative of functions with two or more variables, also the gradients.
To apply partial derivatives to find the extrema of a function.
To understand the double integral and the iterated integral.
To understand the higher dimensional spaces.

sub_name: 波動力學、熱力學和光學
description: 這是一門以理工領域學生為對象並結合微積分的普通物理課程. 課程內容以光學和熱力學的理論和應用為主。探討的主題包含 波動、幾何光學、波動光學(例如 光干涉、光繞射、光偏極)、熱、材料熱學性質和熱力學定律。延伸主題還將包含狹義相對論與近代物理。每週另有實驗課三小時，包括各實驗單元的原理介紹與操作，透過實際的實驗與操作實習協助學生進一步理解。
targets:
理解光學與熱力學基本原理，並能應用於日常生活的光學與熱力學現象的解釋
能架構光學或熱力學實驗，並進行分析

description: Critical thinking is the use of reasoning to determine what is true and what is false. Accordingly, critical thinking is a valuable skill utilised in all disciplines and professions. This Critical Thinking course aims to empower students to think more clearly, insightfully and analytically about what they believe, and be more effective in arguing their views. Students will develop the ability to recognise and avoid common barriers to critical thinking; develop strategies for evaluating evidence and arguments, and learn to formulate and make sound arguments.
targets:
Build up sentence skills and writing skills to write argumentative essays and reports
Locate and evaluate reference sources through library research
Integrate research through appropriate citation and quotation
Locate, interpret, evaluate, and synthesize evidence in a comprehensive way to support ideas
Sequence arguments and evidence logically to draw valid conclusions and to articulate related outcomes (implications and consequences)
Communicate orally and in written form in persuasive and convincing, yet respectful and self-critical manners
Act and communicate competently in different cultural realms with goal-oriented pragmatic attitude

description: This course covers the fundamental concepts and applications of electric/electronic circuits for electrical and computer engineers as well as for engineers who need to gain a broad understanding of this field. The course starts with basic concepts, including charge, current, voltage, and resistive circuits. Essential concepts, devices, theorems, and dc circuits, first-order circuits, and ac circuits will be discussed subsequently. Also discussed are basic electronic components including diodes and transistors and their primary applications.

1.	Experimental exercises in use of laboratory instruments.
2.	Measurements of voltage, current, impedance, frequency and waveform.
3.	Basic circuit analysis and laboratory measurement techniques.
4.	The characteristics of electronic devices: resistors, capacitors, inductors, and diodes.
5.	Design and analysis of filter and sensor circuits.

Historical and political processes shaping U.S. culture, institutions, and society from before European expansion to the Civil War. Focus on the roles of workers, immigrants, and people of color from a comparative perspective. GE Area: D2 Note: Must complete the entire sequence (AAS 33A and 33B) to satisfy U.S. History, U.S. Constitution and California Government (US 1, 2, 3)
The purpose of the course is to examine the historical and political development of the United States from a multicultural perspective. The course will examine the principle events, developments, and problems of the United States from before the era of European expansion through the Civil War, emphasizing the role of class, race, ethnicity, and gender in American history and politics. Since Asian immigrants did not arrive in large numbers until the 1050s, AAS33A will focus on the historical experiences of African Americans, European Americans, Hispanic Americans, and Native Americans, while also noting how gender and sexuality affected the experiences of individuals within these diverse ethnoracial groups. Such an examination of ethnic groups in the United States will help us understand the development of this country as a diverse, multicultural nation.

This course is an introduction to physics. The main emphasis will be on the branch of physics known as mechanics. This is the study of motion and the causes of motion through the applications of fundamental principles of physics. We begin with kinematics, the quantitative description of the motion of particles. We then build on kinematics to learn how and why motion occurs, through the application of Newton's laws of dynamics. Many examples will be considered as we explore the properties of specific forces and the details of the motion they bring about. The next step will be to describe physical processes in terms of energy and momentum, quantities that are always "conserved." Conservation laws allow us to solve problems in mechanics that would be very difficult by other techniques and provide a powerful approach to the analysis of physical systems in general. We then will extend our understanding of motion to the kinematics and dynamics of rotation. Finally, we will briefly study some of the physical properties of solids and fluids.
targets:
Capability to understand most of natural phenomena in physics science with a few fundamental principles and laws of physics associated with dynamics and thermal physics
Ability to systematically approach problems behaving from microscopically to macroscopically, such as the evolution from classical dynamics to quantized atomic systems, or the leading from mechanics to basic thermodynamics
Capability to describe topics of natural phenomena graphically and numerically by way of computer simulations using Easy Java Simulation and Matlab, without intensive training in Mathematics and Programming
Experience to perform simple physical and virtual experiments, using computers and a variety of physics apparatus, including the gathering, interpretation and analysis of experimental data.

LO1.	Students will be able to identify and assess socially significant and intellectual topics, then compose and deliver extemporaneous oral presentations of these topics.
Students will be able to engage in critical and analytical listening
Effectively research, type, and present your speech topic in front of a small or large group of people (target audience), particularly your classmates and instructor (myself), by first attaining (and then maintaining) a high degree of articulation, awareness, confidence, and expression.
Be able to persuade a large percentage of your target audience to concur with your viewpoint(s) that you are sharing with them.
Actively participate with fellow classmates in in-class group activities for the purpose of having a greater chance of achieving the 4 aforementioned goals.

description: Learning the fundamental concepts and frameworks of innovation is just as important as getting hands-on experience. This course will cover the basic concepts of innovation, basic theories, and representative practical cases. Topics will include, but are not limited to, types of innovation, design thinking, business models, and social innovation. The purpose is to equip attendants with basic innovation tools, while having a preliminary experience with these tools through the course project. The project also aims to draw attendants’ attention to creating social impact through innovation.
targets:
be able to use a variety of design methods to investigate and ideate on the topic of sustainability in Feng-Chia market.
engage with design thinking as a mode of innovation in business

description:
Calculus is a course provides basic training in mathematics. It involves the differentiation and the integration. These are used to solve problems via geometry and algebra. Calculus has a lot of
applications in many fields, such as science, engineering, economics and management. The materials in Analytic Geometry and Calculus I include the limits of functions, the derivatives, the integrals, the logarithmic  and exponential functions, and the inverse trigonometric functions
targets:
Understand the limits of functions and be able to compute the limits by applying basic formulas
Understand the definition of the derivatives and be able to compute the derivatives via basic properties
Be able to apply the derivatives to analyze the monotonicity and concavity of functions
Be able to apply the derivatives to solve the maximum and minimum problems
Realize the concept of the integrals and be able to apply fundamental theorem of calculus to compute the integrals
Be able to use a definite integral to obtain the area of the region between curves
Be able to find the derivatives of logarithmic, exponential and inverse trigonometric functions

description: A fun course for building Python programs and analyzing data applications and program design. Students will have gained a fundamental understanding of programming in Python by creating a variety of programs and applications for the Web and for systems development. Python is a versatile programming language, suitable for projects ranging from small programs to large systems. The program emphasizes best practices where students will explore the large standard library of Python, which supports many common programming tasks in everyday applications.

description: This course covers various discrete methods and techniques for representing non-continuous matters, and introduction to a field of practically useful mathematics. Topics include the set theory relations and functions, finite state machines, the principle of inclusion and exclusion, recurrence relations, the principle of counting, and graph theory.
targets:
Comprehension of combination, permutation and generating functions.
Comprehension of recurrence relation and the principle of inclusion and exclusion.
Comprehension and application of the principle of counting and the Polya Theorem.

description: Critical thinking is the use of reasoning to determine what is true and what is false. Accordingly, critical thinking is a valuable skill utilised in all disciplines and professions. This Critical Thinking course aims to empower students to think more clearly, insightfully and analytically about what they believe, and be more effective in arguing their views. Students will develop the ability to recognise and avoid common barriers to critical thinking; develop strategies for evaluating evidence and arguments, and learn to formulate and make sound arguments.
targets:
Understand critical thinking concepts and the validity of arguments.A1
Comprehend the characteristics of effective deductive and inductive reasoning.B2
Effectively utilise argument mapping techniques to evaluate and formulate arguments.C3
Formulate arguments with sound and persuasive reasoning.C3
Detect logical fallacies in arguments.D4
Identify common psychological barriers to logical and critical thinking.E5
Evaluate competing arguments in a controversy in a field that interests the student.F6

description: The purpose of this course is to make the students, via the practical training, to learn the skills of programming and have the ability of programming. The course mainly includes (1) the ability to define at an appropriately high level of abstraction the data structures and algorithms that needed, (2) the ability to devise alternative implementations of data structures, (3) the ability to employ different data structures in algorithm design, and (4) the ability to analyse the time complexity of data structures' operation.
targets:
Learn and understand various kinds knowledge of data structures
Have the ability to use various data structures.
Enhance the ability of programming design.

AWS Academy Cloud Foundations is intended for students who seek an overall understanding of cloud computing concepts, independent of specific technical roles. It provides a detailed overview of cloud concepts, AWS core services, security, architecture, pricing, and support.
readings: AWS Academy Learner Lab provides a long-running sandbox environment for ad hoc exploration of AWS services. Within this class, students will have access to a restricted set of AWS services. You will retain access to the AWS resources set up in this environment for the duration of this course. We limit your budget ($100USD), so you should exercise caution to prevent charges that will deplete your budget too quickly. If you exceed your budget, you will lose access to your environment and lose all of your work.

description: This course focuses the acquisition of basic communicative structures—vocabulary, correct pronunciation, and writing—within a relevant cultural context. The course aims to enable student communication in the target language as quickly as possible. Therefore, instruction will be conducted almost exclusively in Spanish. Students are expected to participate in all class activities and complete homework assignments designed to develop reading and writing skills. Students will be evaluated according to their progress in the five areas: speaking, oral comprehension, reading, writing, and knowledge of the cultures that speak Spanish.
targets:
Achieve speaking and listening skills necessary to deal with familiar survival situations.
Understand short, memorized sentences and phrases with contextual support.
Develop reading comprehension to interpret written language for instructional and directional purposes, and standardized messages (menus, schedules, maps, signs, etc.).
Recognize and produce basic grammatical structures and meaning.

This course is designed to develop public speaking skills . Public speaking is a vital soft skill - be it used in the classroom or for a presentation at work . Each student will develop and deliver several speeches and participate in peer evaluations.

description: 本課程沒有任何先決條件。 當您上課時，強烈的課堂參與是非常重要的。 該課程將涵蓋硬件、軟件以及從當代 MIS 方面將信息通信技術 (ICT) 集成到課程基礎設施的核心部分。 將定期給予個人或小組團隊合作任務，學生的回應將有時間限制，以獲得學分。
targets: 本課程將完全用英語授課。 我強烈建議學生認為本課程是您從管理信息系統 (MIS) 的角度利用當代信息通信技術 (ICT) 為未來國際商務職業生涯的橋樑。 MIS 的成功應用已廣泛應用於許多業務領域，並以前所未有的速度繼續增長。 本課程的主要目的是為學生提供有關在不久的將來在商業應用領域中應用MIS的足夠背景知識。

description: Learning the fundamental concepts and frameworks of innovation is just as important as getting hands-on experience. This course will cover the basic concepts of innovation, basic theories, and representative practical cases. Topics will include, but are not limited to, types of innovation, design thinking, business models, and social innovation. The purpose is to equip attendants with basic innovation tools, while having a preliminary experience with these tools through the course project. The project also aims to draw attendants’ attention to creating social impact through innovation.
targets:
識別並理解漸進性與顛覆性創新的特徵。
理解不同的創新過程。
發展對關鍵社會挑戰的全球視野。
學習有效運用設計研究方法與工具。
發展分析創新專案的可取性、可行性及可持續性的能力。
與團隊成員及創新利益相關者有效合作。
清楚傳達創新專案的理論基礎。

description: 本課程介紹微觀和宏觀經濟學。 本課程涵蓋的主題和問題包括基本經濟問題、價格機制的運作、市場效率的衡量、政府價格和數量的替代控制對市場效率的影響、消費者行為和選擇、生產和成本理論 企業，以及不同市場結構下企業的定價行為； 國民產出、失業率、通貨膨脹、總供給和總需求。
targets:
對微觀經濟概念和理論的理解
應用 - 識別公司面臨的成本的能力
理解與市場結構相關的問題
知識——對市場失靈和政府乾預的認識

description: 本課程介紹了管理商業組織的基本原則，包括關鍵管理概念、模型和環境。 該課程涵蓋管理職能、戰略框架和負責任的管理。
targets:
1 解釋代表管理理論的基本概念、模型和方法；
2 使用基於案例的方法將管理的理論和研究證據應用於實際情況；
3 在組織道德和社會責任的背景下評估管理決策的有效性
4 了解並考慮組織環境對道德和社會責任管理決策的影響。
5 在團隊工作中運用人際交往和溝通技巧

description: 本課程介紹了確定企業收入和財務狀況所必需的概念和分析。 該課程將介紹基本的會計框架，然後繼續教授用於記錄公司交易並最終生成財務報表的原則和技術。 財務報表是公司用來向各種用戶群體（包括經理、投資者和債權人）報告其活動結果的商業文件，而這些各方又使用財務報表來做出各種決策，例如是否投資 或借錢給公司。 成功完成本課程的學生將能夠準備、理解和分析財務報告和相關會計領域的知識，這對商業決策至關重要。
targets:
成功完成本課程後，您應該能夠：
1. 了解財務會計在組織和市場中的作用和目的。
2. 分析和記錄業務交易。
3. 編制財務報表。
4. 分析和解釋財務報表
5. 解釋業務和會計術語，了解業務決策如何影響會計信息。

了解營銷概念及其隱秘的哲學，以及如何將這些概念應用於實際工作場所。
將合理的解決方案應用於分析證據支持的實際營銷問題。
系統地分析營銷過程並整合營銷組合、工具和理論。

應用 Excel 通過數字和圖形程序描述和分析信息。
通過統計推斷獲得關於人口值的可能結論的知識。
理解 - 使用概率論和分佈來估計和檢驗假設。
探索和分析變量之間的關係，學習通過回歸和相關分析來預測戰略變量的值

Softwares: [{'soft_name': 'EXCEL\nSPSS', 'soft_memo': "Excel is part of the Microsoft Office suite and is primarily used for data entry, storage, basic calculations, and creating simple visualizations like charts and graphs. It also provides basic statistical functions., SPSS (Statistical Package for the Social Sciences) is a more advanced tool, primarily used for complex statistical analysis. It's designed to handle large datasets and provides detailed output options for research results. It's particularly useful for social science research due to its capacity for predictive analytics and handling complex statistical tests."}]

integrity:
學期成績記分法
本科目採百分記分法，本科目採等第記分。


出席及缺席
登記為曠課者，曠課一次扣平時成績 5 個百分比分數 。學生請假依本校學生請假辦法辦理，務必要在上課之前，檢附請假理由及文件，線上提出申請。若不在申請期限內完成請假作業者，無充分的理由，經核准不得取消扣分。


課堂互動與參與討論作業
每位學生每週上iLearn 課程討論區，針對當次練習作業進行作答，作答完簽名得分。


作業提交及遲交
每次作業延遲一天則扣分5％。若您能提前通知我，並附上說明和預計完成的時間，我將酌情考量展延繳交作業時間的請求，若理由不充分不會批准請求。用iLearn提交作業，書面資料要使用Microsoft Office/Word、Excel、PowerPoint進行撰寫。


考評及補考
應參加考試之學生，未遵守請假或請假未經核准，而未參加考試者，該科該次考試成績以零分計算。


作弊及抄襲
違反此規則者，該次評核“不計分”或課程“不計分”。如有替考情事，其舞弊之雙方，均依逢甲大學學生獎懲辦法相關規定處理。


加分及補救措施
如果您發現學期出現困難時，如跟不上學習進度、聽不懂、或作業有問題等，請您儘早與老師聯繫，以便幫助您找到解決方案。


學期預警
當我發現您的學習進度跟不上、可能會妨礙學業成功之疑慮時，我可能會發出預警訊息給您、及您的學習導師。如果您收到預警通知，則您有責任盡快與我聯繫，討論學習上問題，將透過諮詢方式，給予您可能的協助。

description: Critical thinking is the use of reasoning to determine what is true and what is false. Accordingly, critical thinking is a valuable skill utilised in all disciplines and professions. This Critical Thinking course aims to empower students to think more clearly, insightfully and analytically about what they believe, and be more effective in arguing their views. Students will develop the ability to recognise and avoid common barriers to critical thinking; develop strategies for evaluating evidence and arguments, and learn to formulate and make sound arguments.
targets:
培養句子技巧和寫作技巧，以撰寫議論文和報告；
通過圖書館研究查找和評估參考資源；
通過適當的引用和引用來整合研究。
以全面的方式定位、解釋、評估和綜合證據以支持觀點；
對論據和證據進行邏輯排序，以得出有效結論並闡明相關結果（含義和後果）。
以有說服力和令人信服但尊重和自我批評的方式進行口頭和書面交流。
以目標導向的務實態度，在不同的文化領域中

description: This course offers a comprehensive foundation in understanding and influencing consumer behavior. You will learn how the psychological, social, and cultural factors influence consumer decision-making and behavior. Key concepts covered in this course include perception, motivation, learning, attitude formation, and the consumer purchase process. Through a blend of theoretical frameworks and real-world case studies, the course provides insights into how consumers process information, form preferences, and make purchasing decisions.
targets:

為參與者提供運用消費者行為概念的實際操作經驗
幫助理解消費者行為中的文化差異
提高對人工智慧對消費者行為影響的認識
提高對學術誠信實踐的認識

description: This course is an introduction to physics. The main emphasis will be on the branch of physics known as mechanics. This is the study of motion and the causes of motion through the applications of fundamental principles of physics. We begin with kinematics, the quantitative description of the motion of particles. We then build on kinematics to learn how and why motion occurs, through the application of Newton's laws of dynamics. Many examples will be considered as we explore the properties of specific forces and the details of the motion they bring about. The next step will be to describe physical processes in terms of energy and momentum, quantities that are always "conserved." Conservation laws allow us to solve problems in mechanics that would be very difficult by other techniques and provide a powerful approach to the analysis of physical systems in general. We then will extend our understanding of motion to the kinematics and dynamics of rotation. Finally, we will briefly study some of the physical properties of solids and fluids.

sub_name: 元宇宙入門-虛擬實境的藝術
description: 在本課程中，學生將學習使虛擬現實成為建築核心工具的技能和理念。 除了技術，學生還將創造一種他們邀請觀眾參與的體驗。什麼樣的體驗，更重要的是，這種體驗的後果是什麼？ 投機元素回答了這個問題。 學生將專注於未來提供的可能性。 雖然建築通常專注於預測的未來（取決於過去的經驗）或可能的未來（取決於技術發展），但 VR 幫助我們進入我們喜歡的未來，我們的行動會帶來一個更宜居的未來世界。 在本課程中，學生將創建關於未來的場景並設計他們的 3D 模型以響應他們的未來計劃。 VR模型將包含一個體驗空間、人、圖像、聲音的新場景……結合實用主義和思辨性，讓我們將建築重新想像成一門藝術。
targets:
了解XR是一個逐漸受到重視的創新技術
應用探知模式來發展XR技術
分析可行的研究模式來解決永續建築議題

description: 本課程將介紹互動設計、藝術設計和機器學習技術的應用。課程中將探討如何利用TouchDesigner實現虛實互動，並投影出具有藝術設計感的互動作品。學生將學習如何使用不同的媒體元素、控制界面、交互技術和機器學習算法，創作出獨特的互動設計作品。通過本課程的學習，學生可以獲得多媒體創意應用的基本理解和能力。

description: 本課程係為線上課程，搭配建築專業院學士、碩士學位學程之專業實習課程，於學生實習期間，進行個人化實習與職涯輔導，關注實習生的實習安全與預防。引導實習生強化職場倫理與態度、實習之權利義務、性別平等、環境安全衛生等進階觀念，並能了解專業實習實務與職業生涯發展關聯性。
targets:
認識職場倫理與態度
了解實習之權利義務、性別平等、環境安全衛生等進階觀念

description: 新型態藝術創作，機器人領域也正在藝術領域被接受。透過機器人概論與實機教學，應用於幾何圖形設計與創作，使學員了解新型態藝術。
targets:
新型態數位藝術創作
機器人創作應用

description: 本課程在強調不以主動授予專業知識、技術為目標，反倒以誘導學生自主學習、促成學生間的合作提案為課程目的。學生將會學習以「溝通」為主要手段，鼓勵學生觀察現象、提出問題、自主提案、組織(人、事、物)有利資源、傾聽各方意見需求、整合出一套完整論述邏輯，並清楚了解自己在團體合作中為什麼樣的關鍵角色。最後可以將此設計思考模式應用於創意設計思考模式中。
targets:
此課程將涵蓋各種設計思維理論，將設計視為一種混合各種研究方法的工具。
學生將實踐這些理論，以便能夠反思設計思維如何在實踐中幫助他們。

sub_name: 建築視域下的海洋城市探索
description: 本課程結合英國AA建築聯盟學院（Architectural Association）Visiting School，的模式，聚焦「海洋都市」的建築與設計議題。透過理論探討、實地參訪與跨領域創作，培養學生因應海洋與都市環境之整合思維，並完成具創新與實踐意義的作品展示。

sub_name: 義大利國際建築實作學習
description: 義大利WAVe工作營是義大利建築專業領域最大的暑假活動之一。每年有超過10個國家、1100位以上的學生參與這個活動。這個工作營每年都會提出一個操作主題，提供學生所學的建築專業知識運用於不同文化氛圍的場域。本課程將涵蓋多元領域，包括新興科技對建築的影響、數位與實體空間的整合、永續發展策略，以及適應性工作環境的設計等。
落實「以強化學生基本體能並建立基礎運動知識」之體育教學宗旨，授課內容如下：（一）游泳課程─同時段依學生游泳能力進行分級分組協同教學。（二）陸上運動課程─依教師專長項目教學，每專項單元授課兩週，循序轉換。
targets: 廣植基礎健康體適能，厚實游泳基本能力，養成規律運動習慣。
textBooks:
一、體育分科教材教法
二、體適能教學
readings:
一、大專體育雙月刊二、運動生理學



三、運動心理學

description: 本課程為繪畫實習課程。課程中，主要以單色鉛筆或炭筆為主要表現素材，初期以基本造形、構圖能力之訓練為主，強調造形比例的精準與否並輔以明暗對比之表現為主要考量。期中期末亦安排其他藝術相關課程，以增進學習之深度及廣度。期末則配合幻燈片等，以記憶速寫來訓練造形速度之能力。本課程特別注重個人自我要求及實踐方法表達，無期中、期末考試。
targets:
學習各種適當的工具和技法來作各種素描創作 。
培養對線條運用的敏感性及表達之能力。

description: 本課程介紹投影幾何基本概念，並學習建築繪圖技巧描述二度與三度空間中建築元素。課程內容安排如下：投影幾何，正投影(三視圖與平行投影圖)，斜投影(平面，光面等斜圖)透視投影(一、二、三消點透視圖)與陰影(平面圖與立體圖))
targets:
說明投影幾何基本概念
學習建築繪圖觀念與技巧,並應用於描述二度與三度空間中建築元素
應用繪圖工具提升溝通與設計技能
textBooks: Francis D.K. Ching, Steven P. Juroszek (2011)。設計圖學(林貞吟譯；二版)。台北：藝術家出版社。
readings: Francis D.K. Ching(2003)。建築：造型、空間與秩序(王玲玉、呂以寧譯；二版)。台北：六和出版社。
weeklyScds: Reading: 課程簡介&圖學原理 | Learning: 再現與轉譯，以線條建構一套具備溝通及思考的圖面系統 || Reading: 觀察、再現&思考(1)：線條的構成意義 | Learning: 1、輕重線&線型、輪廓線 2、觀察與記錄的線條再現 3、設計思考(筆記)的養成 || Reading: 觀察、再現&思考(2) 三視圖原理(1)幾何 | Learning: 1、繪製前的觀察與判斷 2、三視圖幾何原理與實作 || Reading: 尺規製圖方法 | Learning: 尺規工具及工程筆繪圖操作 || Reading: 點線面與形體構成 | Learning: 點線面基本元素與形體構成概念 || Reading: 點線面與形體構成 | Learning: 點線面基本元素與形體構成概念 || Reading: 三視圖原理：建築圖(1) | Learning: 1、建築圖概要 2、線形&權重構成的意義 3、比例關係 4、CNS基本繪圖原則 || Reading: 三視圖原理：建築圖(2) | Learning: 1、建築圖概要 2、線形&權重構成的意義 3、比例關係 4、CNS基本繪圖原則 || Reading: 統籌科目參與期中集中會考 || Reading: 建築平面圖 | Learning: 平面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 建築平面圖 | Learning: 平面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 建築立面圖 | Learning: 立面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 建築立面圖 | Learning: 立面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 建築剖面圖 | Learning: 剖面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 建築剖面圖 | Learning: 剖面圖繪製&CNS繪圖準則 || Reading: 樓梯詳圖 | Learning: 樓梯平面圖&剖面圖繪製原理 || Reading: 等角透視圖&爆炸圖 | Learning: 等角透視原理及繪圖方式 || Reading: 統籌科目參與期末集中會考

scr_teacher: 張子浩,黃郁惠,趙又嬋,朱伯晟,何柏奇,林佳平,許宜珮,鄭孟鴻,饒珮齡,陳琬婷,何思佑,黃馨慧,黃宏毓
description: 本課程為建築的基本設計入門，介紹建築設計的基本元素與組合原理，尤其著重光、影、造型、空間與材料的呈現和設計概念的操作技巧，同時將設計概念完整呈現於2-D版面與立體模型。訓練學生設計作品能綜合理性、知性與感性於思考及創作的過程中。
targets:
能理解建築基本元素操作及基本設計原則
能應用圖面與模型表現於設計創作

description: 本課程給建築新鮮人對建築之初步認識，並介紹現代建築的發展。強調環境變遷下永續建築之重要，體驗建築，並了解建築設計原理。首先要學生了解什麼是建築，建築的意義何在，其本質與環境之間的關係何在。
targets: 能了解建築相關領域之基本知識

description: 本課程旨在介紹機器學習的基本概念和應用，並通過實際案例分享幫助學生理解機器學習技術的應用以及?發。課程中將介紹機器學習的基本算法和技術，包括監督式學習、非監督式學習和強化學習。透過分享最新的機器學習應用案例，讓學生了解機器學習在現實生活中的應用和能力。通過本課程的學習，學生將會學到機器學習的基本理解和應用能力。
targets:
理解機器學習的基本概念和算法
具備機器學習的基本理論與技術概念對現實中的應用和挑戰進行議題研究提案與表達之能力

description: 「人文」是所有知識建構的背景，「科學」則是人類進步的推手。當人類社會因「科學」發展而演化，人文關懷勢將變得更為重要。「人文」學習在於培養學生同理心，理解自我與他人的不同需求及想法，而能更好應用「科學」所帶來的先進科技；「人文」學習也在於培養學生批判思考，而能思索「科學」所帶來的各種影響。本課程將基於「人文」關懷，思考「科學」發展對社會帶來的影響以及想像人類未來發展的理想，讓同學瞭解「人文」與「科學」兩者共融的重要性。
targets:
培養多元領域學習的興趣並瞭解人文與科學兩者共融的重要性。
培養學生同理心及批判思考的能力。

description: 使學生瞭解武器系統發展概況、我國國防科技政策與國軍主要武器裝備，導引學生對國防科技的興趣，進而認同國防、支持國防
targets: 建立國防科技知能，拓展國防科技視野。
textBooks: 幼獅編輯小組編（2018）。國防科技。臺北：幼獅。
readings: 具備高中全民國防教育課程先備知識及核心素養

description: 本課程旨在培養學生兼備人文素養、道德情操、正確價值觀，同時理解自由、平等、民主、法治的真諦，成為一位關懷人民、社會、國家，以其所學付諸實踐的現代公民。

sub_name: 建築・人文・自然對話
description:
本課程透過建築的視角探討人與自然之間的關係，研究建築環境如何調節人與自然的互動。我們將思考人類在景觀中留下的痕跡、建築在引導感知方面的作用，以及透過全球與生態關係（Bruno Latour、Albena Yaneva 等）的理論框架來重新思考我們在生態系統中的位置。
課程主題涵蓋氣候適應型建築、居住空間以及挑戰以人類為中心設計觀點的後人類視角。本課程強調閱讀相關文獻、撰寫反思報告，並透過小組討論來分析和探討建築專案。
targets:
透過建築理解人與自然的關係
評估不同方法，從實踐與理論層面重新思考我們對建築的方式與觀點。

description: 中國歷史之久遠與幅員之廣大，造成中國傳統建築在基本上呈現多樣化之型式，本課程冀望透過對中國傳統建築之瞭解與分析,認識其背後所隱藏之思想觀念與人文思想。在建築類型上，有關民居、宮殿、城市、聚落、園林、陵墓等，本課程亦深入討論其特徵與特質。
targets:
對於中國建築史的發展過程與脈絡能夠有基本的認識與了解。
經由對中國建築史的討論，瞭解建築史在建築設計與建築發展過程中的重要性，透過課程的訓練思考，掌握設計課程與建築史之間的關聯性與啟發性。
經由對中國建築的研究，學習如何掌握傳統語彙、空間模式與空間關係運用於規劃設計之構思中。
透過建築文獻及相關人文書籍的深入閱讀，建立建築環境之人文價值與深層內涵。
藉由東、西方傳統建築之比較分析，確立本土文化定位，並培養學生具國際觀之文化視野。
由閱讀圖說及模型製作，充分認識中國建築特有之木構造形式與工法，並學習傳統建築之圖說特殊表現技巧。
經由分組案例研究報告，對於屬於傳統建築的作品都能提出一套屬於自己的評論與分析的方法，並且透過學期報告來展現自身對建築的觀察能力。

scr_teacher: Lorena Alessio,王子熙,周郁森,張維元,林衍良,謝伯昌,陳俐廷,王志仁,杜俊賢
description: 為實質建築設計之開端，接續大一之創意基本設計訓練，透過 1)設計概念、創作及操作；2)空間元素、形式及材質分析；3)抽象設計概念與實質環境關聯之初探；4)模型操作與圖面繪製之表達技能，再藉由簡單機能與行為活動之建築空間設計，訓練學生建構設計概念，尋求自我對真實空間之解讀與操作，且擁有詮釋空間氛圍與情境的形態邏輯或設計語法，以對空間概念的表達能具體呈現。
targets:
能具備觀察與分析人與物理環境、機能需求與活動行為之知識
能理解空間尺度及空間組織之重要性
能應用圖面與模型表達建築設計成果
能分析建築設計中基本課題

description: 「建築物理」涵蓋建築物理環境中有關音、光、熱、氣、水等各面向的建築環境理論，為建築環境控制的基礎。本課程以定量且科學的方法解析居住環境之物理現象，並提供設計規劃應用之依據，打造舒適、健康、節能之建築環境。
targets:
能瞭解建築物理學的意義，並瞭解其對都市環境的影響。
能瞭解建築物理的各項環境要素對於人生活於室內空間的舒適性之影響。
能瞭解各項物理環境要素的原理及計算方法。
能瞭解如何應用各項物理環境要素於建築設計上。
能以書面或口頭方式將所獲結果與教師溝通。

description: 「建築物理」涵蓋建築物理環境中有關音、光、熱、氣、水等各面向的建築環境理論，為建築環境控制的基礎。本課程以定量且科學的方法解析居住環境之物理現象，並提供設計規劃應用之依據，打造舒適、健康、節能之建築環境。
targets:
能瞭解建築物理學的意義，並瞭解其對都市環境的影響。
能瞭解建築物理的各項環境要素對於人生活於室內空間的舒適性之影響。
能瞭解各項物理環境要素的原理及計算方法。
能瞭解如何應用各項物理環境要素於建築設計上。
能以書面或口頭方式將所獲結果與教師溝通。

description: 本課程止在培育學員具備3D創意設計以及製造整合的觀念, 深植3D Design and Maker的專業技能。以期發揮具備社會實踐精神的、無邊界的、” CDIO未來大學”理念。
targets:
3D設計
3D動畫

description: 課程提供給學生靜力學結構工程技巧的基本原則及應用。  教該如何將力量轉成支持並且達成穩定的平衡情況。學習了解，物體任何載重經過的平衡類型情況，而且產生結構的行為。
targets:
能認識靜力學之基本原理及平衡概念
能判別基本力量類型與支承形式
能計算梁結構基本類型的支承反力及簡單桁架的桿件內力

description: 課程提供給學生靜力學結構工程技巧的基本原則及應用。  教該如何將力量轉成支持並且達成穩定的平衡情況。學習了解，物體任何載重經過的平衡類型情況，而且產生結構的行為。
targets:
能認識靜力學之基本原理及平衡概念
能判別基本力量類型與支承形式
能計算梁結構基本類型的支承反力及簡單桁架的桿件內力

description: 課程分兩方面，（一）從生理學、心理學、電腦、工業設計、工業安全等領域探討使用者的各項生理及心理之限制及需要,以及認識正確的產品設計與正確尺寸的應用；（二）建築空間的基本人體尺寸、空間尺寸與生活基本機能的認識。課程重點置於室內設計時之符合人體工學之尺度的應用。
targets:
知識重點在於同時理解掌握設計者與使用者之空間尺度行為與人體工學之相關尺寸
理解人體工學之基本尺寸與空間尺度及使用行為模式之對話準確性
有效應用人因工程之空間行為概念及人因尺寸於室內及建築之規劃設計中。

description: 本課程以因應建築教育改革計畫中提出專業英語教學與國際化接軌，授課內容英語教學與建築學專業培養相結合，加強建築學專業英語之實際應用能力。
targets:
建築專業英語知識的能力培養
建築專業英語的應用

description: 本課程從個人心理逐步探討人與環的關係: 人與空間的關係，人與都市、人與社會、人與文化的關係。
targets:
培養學生具備基本環境心理學知識
讓學生了解人與環境的關係
強化學生環境社會與文化認知

description:
1.分析空間設計中關於材料所代表的價值－認識材料，還原材料本質。
2.藉由討論瞭解空間中材料所展現的文化意義－涵構意義。
3.建立學生培養生活中材料開發的創意及敏感度。
targets:
材料於空間運用原理
材料分析原理
材料加工方法

description: 透過了解建築相關(知識)領域之基本架構，解析建築開發過程中，整合各專業領域知識，作為建構建築設計方法與原則之整體前置計劃。
targets:
能分析建築相關領域之資料
能應用建築計劃概念，執行設計
能綜合建築與環境之條件，提出看法與論述

description: 本課程將涵蓋建築物的機械，管道和電氣系統中涉及的原理和設備。 一個特別的重點將是與每個系統相關的設備的佈局以及每個系統服務的分佈，例如佈線、導管、管道和管道系統。 這些概念的工作知識將成為學生創建協調建築設計過程中的有用指南。
targets:
知識重點置於建築設計與使用之立場去理解與此相關之建築設備及管線系統；
可描述建築設備及管線的種類及其用途

能夠理解建築設備之用途及其在建築設計中的重要性，以及設備管線佈局對於使用者之重要性
能夠將建築設備系統知識應用到建築設計及建築工程之中

scr_teacher: 劉字禎,劉志仁,林幸長,高雅楓,張涵瑋,蔡慈媛,黃文縈,陳品蓁,陳維凱,楊智傑,戴祖亮
description: 本設計課程的目標是幫助同學，具備掌握單體建築與回應基地周邊環境之設計能?。實際演練操作建築設計主題(1)『複合單體建築類型』及(2)『社區建築環境類型』;訓練同學能夠分析基地條件和使用者需求，配合當代的從搖籃到搖籃、綠建築或追尋地方文化創意議題，進行設計概念與設計案之發展。能夠以簡報軟體、徒手繪製、電腦繪圖、模型製作來溝通表達其設計圖說與創意。
targets:
能夠配合當代議題，如：從搖籃到搖籃、綠建築或追尋地方文化創意等，進行建築設計概念與設計案之發展。
同學能夠分析基地條件和使用者需求。並且透過國內外相關案例分析，建立對於建築設計之國際觀。
具備掌握單體建築與回應基地周邊環境之設計能力。能夠以簡報軟體、徒手繪製、電腦繪圖、模型製作來溝通表達其設計圖說與創意。

description: 旨在說明結構學之基本原理以及介紹靜定與超靜定結構的分析方法，瞭解不同結構類型藉由不同分析方式處理，進而得知結構整體受力的分佈狀況與變位情形。
targets:
能認識靜定結構與超靜定結構的分析方法
能判別剛架結構基本的穩定條件
能使用適當的分析方法計算剛架結構的內力分佈及變形

description: 旨在說明結構學之基本原理以及介紹靜定與超靜定結構的分析方法，瞭解不同結構類型藉由不同分析方式處理，進而得知結構整體受力的分佈狀況與變位情形。
targets:
能認識靜定結構與超靜定結構的分析方法
能判別剛架結構基本的穩定條件
能使用適當的分析方法計算剛架結構的內力分佈及變形

description: 本系列課程有基礎班和進階班。在基礎階段，介紹建築BIM元件的管理、BIM參數和元件的整合、初階的BIM軟體程式設計與開發。在進階階段，將涵蓋BIM自動化軟體程式設計與開發、CAD軟體的整合和客製化、BIM和施工現場及工廠機器的整合、如何在設計、繪圖、施工、物業管理各階段使用在課堂上開發的BIM軟體來輔助偵錯和自動修正、如何以自己開發的BIM軟體在2D和3D空間操控元件、應用個人電腦、伺服器、和雲端。訓練有建築相關背景的學生學習電腦輔助設計、施工、和物業管理，熟悉如何開發建築相關的BIM軟體，利用電腦智能來提高建築業工作流程的正確性和效率。
targets:
BIM技術養成
施工圖
Softwares: [{'soft_name': '1.autoCAD REVIT\n2.Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022', 'soft_memo': 'Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022, https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/zh-hant/vs/community/'}]

description: 本課程主要在討論從啟蒙運動到第一次世界大戰後在西方建築史上的發展歷程。在本課程中，我們所關切的是近代建築思潮的發展脈絡以及其相關文化和社會上的議題。尤其是如何看待建築學與藝術、科學和哲學等不同學門之間的發展與影響。本課程要求學生熟悉該時期建築風格主義、建築大師與代表作品，並且能夠查詢與閱讀相關建築作品與論述。
targets:
對於近代建築史的思潮發展、建築大師及其作品能夠有系統性的認識。能夠區分近代建築史中如：新藝術、風格派、包浩斯、國際式樣等在思潮與作品上的特色，增進對於近代建築發展之國際觀。
思考建築史在建築設計過程中的重要性，同時透過課程的訓練，能將所學應用在建築設計上。

sub_name: 建築材料綜合性理解與應用
description: 本課程著重於建築材料特性認識、設計運用、施工與組裝。重點課程1/4著重於鋼材設計到製造與安裝過程、1/4著重於預拌混凝土材料特性與設計到模板組裝與施工、1/4著重於木結構與其它環保建材特性與施工組裝、1/4著重於實際操作或實地參訪，為課程四大主軸。
targets:
介紹建築業界國內外常見建築材料
理解建築業界主流使用材料與應用範圍
應用所學建築材料知識在工程細節圖上
綜合性瞭解建築業界主流使用材料與應用範圍
理解國內外永續發展趨勢與新型材料

integrity:
成績相關規定
	
期中、期末會依時間線上公佈成績。(Midterm and the final result will post on the school’s learning platform)
期末須將學期指定成果上傳至雲端繳交，包含設計定案圖說及報告書等相關資料，未繳交者扣總分10分。(Specific coursework will be requested to upload onto an online platform. If a student fails to upload the requested file at the end of the semester, one whole letter grade drops)


期中與末成績:
	
期中與期末成績不及格時，一律不接受『補交與補考』。(If a student fails the midterm or the final, no make-up exam or equivalent will be issued)
期中與期末考試請假『僅限』重大事故，須出示證明文件，並須在規定時間內提完成補考與補件給予分數。逾時視同放棄。(If a student missed the midterm or the final due to unforeseen events, only the university's acceptable excuses will be accepted. The student must provide the document promptly)


本學期此課額外花費與注意事項:
	
學期中『者』會有額外共同花費，包含移地教學交通車費用等相關花費。所有費用計算與收據會線上透明公開，並且由老師與學生一起平分。 如無參加移地教學的學生，不需要分擔共同花費，但會被扣分與失去繳交移地教學相關作業權利。(This course may have extra costs, including field trips and traveling expenses. A detailed cost breakdown and receipts will be posted on the school’s online learning platform. The final cost will be shared among teachers and students. No sharing cost will be necessary if a student can not attend the trip. However, this student will forgo the right to upload trip-related reports.)





學期中移地教學『者』會有安全穿著規定，如果學生沒有達到安全穿著或現場檢查不合格者，一律不可進入移地教學場所。(Students must wear proper safety clothing and hardware during field trips. If one does not meet the safety standard, then one can not enter the visiting facility.)
學期中參加移地教學者一律『須要』簽相關安全文件與投保相關意外險，檢查不合格者一律不可進入移地教學場所。(Students must sign proper safety documents before field trips. If one does not sign the safety standard, then one can not enter the visiting facility.)
本學期此課出勤考核辦法如下:
	
缺課：為充分考核同學之用功情形，本課程嚴格要求同學出席上課，每週於上課時間內定時點名，（至少一次），未到者一律以缺課論送教務處登記。曠課『合計總數』超過 6 次以上者，皆列入警告與不及格名單，若有特殊狀況（重病、家庭變故等）請提早告知老師並討論。(Attendance is required in this course. If one misses more than 6 classes during the semester, one will be issued a failing grade as a warning. If a student misses the class due to unforeseen events, only the university's acceptable excuses will be accepted. The student must provide the document promptly.)
移地教學缺課: 未到者一律以缺課論送教務處登記，並且扣『總分』5分，若有特殊狀況（重病、家庭變故等）請提早告知老師並討論。(If a student misses the course field trips, each time will result in a 5 points deduction from the final grade. If a student misses the class due to unforeseen events, only the university's acceptable excuses will be accepted. The student must provide the document promptly.)
移地教學脫隊: 未到者一律以缺課論送教務處登記，並且扣『總分』10分，若有特殊狀況（重病、家庭變故等）請提早告知老師並討論。(If a student attended the field trips but straggler during the visit, each time will result in a 10 points deduction from the final grade. If a student misses the class due to unforeseen events, only the university's acceptable excuses will be accepted. The student must provide the document promptly.)


移地教學地點及目的 (學期拜訪地點至少三個):
	
潤弘精密工程事業股份有限公司/ 桃園
		目的:觀看建築實際預鑄過程與上課教材連結。
		Field Trip: Ruentex Engineering & Construction Co., Ltd. / Taoyuan
		Objective: Observe the course's precasting process and teach content in practice.
亞東預拌混凝土/台中市工業區
		目的:觀看預拌混凝土過程及材料測試與上課教材連結。
		Field Trip: Yatung Ready-Mixed Concrete / Taichung Industrial Park
		Objective: Observing the course's concrete mixture and teaching content in practice. 
信暐鋼構股份有限公司/彰化溪湖 
		目的:觀看建築鋼鐵結構製造過程與上課教材連結。
		Field Trip: Shin Wei Steel Structure Co., Ltd. / Xihu, Changhua
		​​​​​​​Objective: Observe the course's steel structure-making process and teaching content in practice.

description: 本課程主要在分析景觀風格與景觀發展變遷趨勢，闡述景觀生態與環境心理與行為之相關基礎理論，藉由理論的闡述，案例介紹與實際操作練習，使理論能落實應用到景觀與環境規劃設計。
targets:
了解景觀建築基本觀念
了解景觀建築相關理論

VanDerZanden, A.M and Rodie,S.N. (2008) Landscape Design: theory and Application Cengage Learning Asia Pte.Ltd. ISBN：9781418012861
李麗雪(譯) ，(2011) ，景觀設計原理與應用， 六合出版社， 台北。 ISBN:978-986-6121-36-4
readings: 侯錦雄、李素馨譯 ， (1990)， 景觀設計元素 ，地景企業有限公司， 台北。   ISBN：9579979731

sub_name: 生成式人工智慧輔助設計
description: 本課程介紹生成式人工智慧的倫理及發展, 教導學生應用生成式人工智慧於建築、景觀及室內設計。

scr_teacher: 莊淵源,陳世國,黃宣穆,吳保寬,劉柏昇,黃文彬,謝銘峯,王昭凱,Nicolas Marechal,呂耀中,葉志正,盛郁庭
description: 著重整體環境規劃與設計：包括群體建築之規劃與設計；開放空間之探討。設計方法之強化：以既有設計方法論，檢討建築設計最佳化之可行性。強調規劃設計過程，包含規劃目標、資料收集、分析、調查和研究，引導獲得正確的規劃方法。設計題目由各組指導老師出題。

建築施工圖的繪製是緊接在建築設計完成後的一道「界面整合」手續。施工圖的繪製一方面除了將初期的設計實質化(如：尺寸和材料選擇)外，同時也是作為參與人員的溝通工具與施工依據：對內與施工圖繪製人員討論；對外與專業廠商和業主協商。另外，施工圖的製作又牽涉到「建築法規檢討」和「施工成本估算」，可見施工圖在整個營建過程中所扮演的重要性。本施工圖的課程主要去強調施工圖之「界面整合」的功能。經由本課程，學生將建立一整體的施工圖相關知識：(1)瞭解那些界面(如：不同的材料和不同的專業廠商考量)需要仔細地處理與其施工的可行性；(2)具備基本的施工圖的繪圖能力；(3)習得讀圖和識圖的基本的技能；與(4)熟悉設計、施工圖及營造三者之間的緊密關連。
本課程教授學生學習由基地環境與使用者需求思索設計解答構想或策略，並從整體環境觀點提出建築設計方案，使新建築物能與其周圍環境和諧共處。
targets:
資料收集與分析－基地環境因子
               －使用者需求調查


建築計畫書製作概要

景觀感覺與素材
通路設計
住宅設計及社區規劃

description: 本課程目的在使同學瞭解環境規劃的基本理論、生態環境規劃理論與環境規劃流程與內容，並能將其應用於環境規劃上。藉由主題規劃操作練習、案例解析與多媒體應用，培養學生實際操作環境規劃案之能力。
targets:
了解環境規劃基本觀念及理論
了解環境規劃操作步驟
培養環境規劃圖面與多媒體展現的能力

曹正，2015，遊憩、景觀與環境規劃方法論-四化目標達成法 華立圖書股份有限公司。(建議買)
ISBN：9789577846006

張俊彥 洪佳君 曾心嫻等譯，2001，景觀建築及土地使用計畫之景觀生態原則 地景企業股份有限公司 ISBN：9570431172

sub_name: 數位環境分析與理論閱讀
description: 這個課程規劃是基礎於Prof. Raoul Bunschoten 發展的一套可供建築和都市設計的創新設計方法論；我們稱之為都市廊道(Urban Gallery)。都市廊道理論是一套聚焦在減緩和適應氣候變遷所帶給都市衝擊和壓力的設計方法。本課程核心是「數位環境分析」與「理論閱讀」。透過這樣的教學，讓學生了解如何將環境分析實質的做出來並反應在設計的配置發展中。
textBooks: 1. 失根城市：當代都市的斷裂、擬仿、與公共空間的消失
readings:
《失根城市：當代都市的斷裂、擬仿、與公共空間的消失》是一本探討當代都市空間變遷、現代化進程中公共空間消失現象的書籍，主要關注城市的「失根」現象。這本書的內容涵蓋了現代城市如何在現代化過程中進行建設、拆除與重建，導致了城市的記憶與根基的消失，並且強調了這些變遷對都市生活質感與市民的影響。
 
書中的「斷裂」指的是過去與現在之間的都市文化斷層，城市歷史與傳統的遺失；「擬仿」則探討了城市景觀中模仿與重建的現象，這些可能並非出於真實需求，而是對過去城市面貌的某種模仿或重製；而「公共空間的消失」則是指隨著城市化的發展，公共場所逐漸被私人化或商業化，市民的共同空間逐步縮小，造成社會的分裂與異化。
weeklyScds: Reading: 課程簡介與報告分組 理論導讀: 失根的城市 || Reading: 理論導讀: 世界盡在購物中心 || Reading: 分組簡報：矽谷神秘屋Part1 || Reading: 分組簡報：矽谷神秘屋Part2 || Reading: 分組簡報：新城市，新邊疆Part1 || Reading: 分組簡報：新城市，新邊疆Part2 || Reading: 分組簡報：深入虛空城市（場景一～場景五） || Reading: 分組簡報：深入虛空城市（場景六～場景十） || Reading: 分組簡報：分天遁地 - 打造假城市Part1 || Reading: 分組簡報：分天遁地 - 打造假城市Part2 || Reading: 分組簡報：洛杉磯要塞Part1 || Reading: 分組簡報：洛杉磯要塞Part2 | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 分組簡報：待售城市Part1 | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 分組簡報：待售城市Part2 | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 設計論述發表（第一組） | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 設計論述發表（第二組） | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 設計論述發表（第三組） | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評 || Reading: 設計論述發表（第四組） | Learning: 每位同學5分鐘簡報，簡報後老師講評

description: 本課程介紹淨零建築與建築產業ESG趨勢，並從建築全生命週期「使用碳排（OC）」與「蘊含碳排（EC）」的觀點，培育學生具備建築產業淨零轉型的專業知識與評估診斷能力，進而探討從近零邁向淨零的減碳設計策略。
targets:
能夠定義「淨零建築」的意涵，瞭解其對於建築產業發產趨勢之影響及重要性。
理解淨零建築設計之概念與執行策略。
學習建築能效與蘊含碳排計算之實務，並進行操作評估。

description: 經由課堂上建築設計理論的講授外，藉由此實習課程的參加，使同學實際了解建築事務所之營運，進而熟悉與了解建築設計實際的方法及應用技術。實習課程規定：1.本建築設計實習課程，每年將開設於建築學士學位學程五年級上學期必修課程，為4學分之課程。學生須於五年級上學期時選修該門課程。2.實習總成績70﹪為實習機構之評比分數，30﹪為實習報告分數。3.一經查核符合實習期滿者，則給予該門課程學分。本課程為4學分之專業必修課程，學生應於與本系專業領域相關之機關、團體、公司或事務所實際參予實務工作320小時，並經負責人或主管人員簽證評比後取得本課程之學分。

scr_teacher: 劉柏昇,曾韋翔,吳保寬,呂耀中,周郁森,張莉欣,戴群峰,劉志仁,呂政道,戴宏一,蕭俊碩,高敬賢,謝文泰,王昭凱,羅元均,簡志穎,粘晉榕,吳承軒,謝舒惠,葉嘉,鄭
description: 畢業設計為二學期一年的課程,第一學期鼓勵同學挑戰當今複雜的都市議題,學生個人或二人一組各自選擇自己的題目.內容則著眼于基地分析與計畫書之寫作流程,特定基地建構特定的地域特質.期末繳交設計草案與模型.
本課程著重於如何認識建築相關領域產業之經營與管理。重點課程1/2著重於企業經營管理之認114著重際企業訪之互動、1/4建築創新思維之提案,為課程三大主軸。
落實「以強化學生基本體能並建立基礎運動知識」之體育教學宗旨，授課內容如下：（一）游泳課程─同時段依學生游泳能力進行分級分組協同教學。（二）陸上運動課程─依教師專長項目教學，每專項單元授課兩週，循序轉換。
targets: 廣植基礎健康體適能，厚實游泳基本能力，養成規律運動習慣。

description: 本課程為繪畫實習課程。課程中，主要以單色鉛筆或炭筆為主要表現素材，初期以基本造形、構圖能力之訓練為主，強調造形比例的精準與否並輔以明暗對比之表現為主要考量。期中期末亦安排其他藝術相關課程，以增進學習之深度及廣度。期末則配合幻燈片等，以記憶速寫來訓練造形速度之能力。本課程特別注重個人自我要求及實踐方法表達，無期中、期末考試。
targets:
學習各種適當的工具和技法來作各種素描創作 。
培養對線條運用的敏感性及表達之能力。

description: 本課程旨在介紹機器學習的基本概念和應用，並通過實際案例分享幫助學生理解機器學習技術的應用以及?發。課程中將介紹機器學習的基本算法和技術，包括監督式學習、非監督式學習和強化學習。透過分享最新的機器學習應用案例，讓學生了解機器學習在現實生活中的應用和能力。通過本課程的學習，學生將會學到機器學習的基本理解和應用能力。
targets:
理解機器學習的基本概念和算法
具備機器學習的基本理論與技術概念對現實中的應用和挑戰進行議題研究提案與表達之能力

description: 本課程介紹室內設計的內容範圍、基礎理論與基本認知，包含空間與設計語彙、室內設計元素、人體工學、室內物環與材料等，引導學生對室內設計的學習興趣，打開學生的視野，與國際的設計脈動銜接。以主題性的方式來進行，每一主題內容皆包括講授、演講、小組報告，並有一實地參訪，以達成融入課程之主動學習模式。
targets:
認識空間與設計語彙、室內設計元素、人體工學、室內物環與材料。
知道何處可找到室內設計的相關資訊，並可評估所獲資訊的適用性。

description: 藉由室內設計的進階課程，使學生對建築空間的場所特質與事件意義有更細膩的認識與運用。本課程的設計將以參與式現場設計施工為課程主軸，並分為團隊創作與個別創作兩階段實施。逐步導入專業的室內設計領域，藉由每週的實際操作訓練與範例討論，將設計理論與工程實務融合為一，並以1:1之作品實體呈現。今日空間觀點與定義、空間的公共與私有、空間的結構與表現形式與使用者、現況調查與測繪方法、室內設計圖說家具創作介紹、材料運用與工法、光環境、視覺傳達運用
targets:
訓練學生理性分析、創意思考、解決設計問題之能力
培養學生對人的空間心理、行為、活動模式及其所處文化及社會背景相關性之瞭解

description: 本課程止在培育學員具備3D創意設計以及製造整合的觀念, 深植3D Design and Maker的專業技能。以期發揮具備社會實踐精神的、無邊界的、” CDIO未來大學”理念。
targets:
3D設計
3D動畫

description: 本課程旨在介紹室內設計中常用的構造和材料，以及它們在設計實踐中的應用。通過理論講解和實際案例分析，學生將瞭解不同材料的性質、優缺點，以及在室內設計中的選用原則。課程內容包括常見材料的性質與應用、材料選擇原則、材料之間的相互作用等相關主題，旨在為學生提供專業知識和技能，加強其在室內設計領域的實踐能力。
targets:
瞭解不同室內設計材料的特性和應用場景。
掌握常見建築材料的性質、特點和選用原則。
能夠根據設計需求合理選擇材料，並將其應用於實際設計項目中。
理解材料選擇對設計風格、功能性和美感的影響，並能夠做出適切的設計決策。
培養學生的實踐能力和創意思維，提升其在室內設計領域的設計水平。

description: 瞭解色彩在生活中的運用，培養設計領域中所需的色彩學常識與敏感度，熟練色彩的表現方法，運用色彩練習以引發想象力與創造力
targets: 使學生具有專業設計作品展現（圖面、多媒體）之色彩學知識與能力

description: 本課程主要在討論從工業革命後在室內設計及其相關家具設施的發展歷程。在本課程中，我們所關切的是室內設計風格的發展脈絡，其相關文化與時代背景的關係，以及設計大師及其作品的呈現。尤其是如何看待室內設計與藝術、流行和科技等不同領域之間的發展與影響。本課程要求學生熟悉該時期室內設計的風格主義、設計大師與代表作品，並且能夠查詢與閱讀相關設計作品及論述。
targets:
對於室內設計風格的發展脈絡、設計大師及其作品能夠有充足的認識。學生能夠區分室內設計風格中如：新藝術、風格派、包浩斯、國際式樣等在作品上的特色，增進對於室內設計發展之國際觀。
思考室內設計史在空間設計過程中的重要性，同時透過課程的訓練，能將所學應用在室內設計上。

description: 空間綠化對提升空間適意性、調節微氣候、淨化空氣與抒壓有著重要的效果。本課程目的在訓練學生認識常用景觀與室內植物及植栽設計原則，透過植栽設計練習與實務操作，使同學了解如何利用植物來營造戶外與室內空間。
targets:
認識室內植物
應用室內植物於建築與室內空間設計
執行室內綠化實務操作與維管

description: 細部設計為空間設計執行實務裡,最直接而務實的一部份,包括從哲學理論、行為學、工程材料及構造, 基於繪圖學的基礎,教導學習者從作品及製作工場(或工地)的導覽中, 學習如何閱讀及繪製細部施工圖.
targets:
學習者能了解細部設計於實務執行中的位階及重要性,並了解相關知識對細部設計之影響.
由施工圖之反覆套繪中,讓學習者習得閱讀及繪製細部施工圖之基本能力.
對軟件傢俱施工細部的繪製及施作尺寸分析
室內材料認識及應用

description: 纖維藝術與織品設計是二十世紀初以降設計教育中重要的一環，它是結構、材質與色彩的遊戲，也是地方風土、傳統文化與科學技術的表徵。
targets:
纖維材料與編織技法介紹
織品結構與肌理的探討與表現
當代纖維藝術思潮討論---例:a.空間與光線 b.身體與容器c.時間與經驗

description: 本課程將教授學生對了法律架構的基本了解、對雇主保守企業機密。本課程也讓學生對人民團體能有整體的認知，從而在專業性職業團體組織運作中培養敬業精神與職業倫理，並希望學生在畢業後成為知分寸、有立場、能明辨是非和能做正確抉擇、術德兼備的專業人員。
targets:
了解基本法律架構、能分辨是非，並做正確的抉擇，成為術德兼備的專業人員。


在專業性職業團體組織中能有敬業精神，並了解團隊合作及社會貢獻的重要性。

sub_name: 淨零永續環境規劃與設計
description: 本課程探討淨零與減碳環境規劃設計的核心理論與實踐，透過國內外案例分析，了解當前全球趨勢與前沿技術。課程內容涵蓋綠色建築設計、低碳城市規劃、永續材料應用、能源管理策略，以及生態基礎設計等關鍵議題，並引導學生思考如何將淨零與永續概念整合至建築與室內空間設計中。課程中，將透過講授、案例討論、設計實作與跨領域交流，培養學生在永續環境規劃與設計領域的專業能力，為未來的建築與室內設計實踐奠定基礎。

scr_teacher: Lorena Alessio,林葳,何傳新,葉欲揚
description: 藉由室內設計的進階課程，使學生對環境、建築、室內、景觀等場所特質、事件意義、及議題有更進階的研究、認識與運用。本課程的設計將以發掘環境設計議題為課程主軸，可以組隊與個別創作。逐步導入的設計操作包括1)議題文本，2)基地文本，3)設計文本，4)圖說文本；藉由每週的實際操作訓練與範例討論，將設計經由議題批判性延伸至基地選擇及分析，案例分析及設計理論與操作，至圖面表現、模型製作、3D模擬、至工程與實務融合為一之施工圖訓練。
targets:
引導學生關心社會現象、人文歷史、國際趨勢及當代議題，全方位思考空間與環境之議題。
訓練報告書寫作、圖說表現法、模型製作、多媒體運用及實物操作等，培養完整的建築作品表達能力。

description: 藉由此實習課程的參加，使同學實際了解室內設計事務所之營運，進而熟悉了解室內設計實際的方法及應用技術。實習課程規定：1.本室內設計實習課程，每年將開設於室內設計組4年級上學期必修課程，為4學分之課程。學生須於4年級上學期時選修該門課程。2.實習總成績80﹪為實習機構之評比分數，20﹪為實習報告分數。3.一經查核符合實習期滿者，則給予該門課程學分。本課程為4學分之專業必修課程，學生應於與室內設計專業領域相關之機關、團體、公司或事務所實際參予實務工作320小時，並經負責人或主管人員簽證評比後取得本課程之學分。
targets:
整合理論課程與實務上的專業技術	
增進學生於室內設計專業上實務經驗的認識	
訓練學生於實質設計中的專業技能

sub_name: 室內裝修工程估價與防火安全
description: 從工程案例切入對設計圖與實際工程施作的理解及掌握；包含施工工程項目與估價作業兩部分1.施工工程項目包含各類工程材料使用、施工技術、施工程序、施工圖說判讀及繪製等實務2.估價項目包含市場計價、估算作業、工料分析、預算書與標單編制等作業實務。此外在課程的最後也將介紹建築物的消防安全與設備，其內容包括最新公佈的消防法規、警報設備、滅火設備、排煙與煙控設備、避難逃生設備、防火避難設施等。讓同學在學習裝修工程及價格的認識之餘也瞭解消防安全與設備對建築物防火安全的重要性。
targets:
對工程施工及設計圖的對照銜接
使能熟知設計工程項目之作業實務
使能理解建築裝修工程材料與構造及施工作業配合
增加消防安全的相關知識，使修課同學瞭解其重要性。

description: 本課程闡述建築閒置空間再利用的理論與設計策略，並介紹國內外閒置空間再利用的案例，引導學生從社會活動面、經營管理面、結構修繕面、環境整合面來進行建築空間的再生與活化。
targets:
認知建築閒置空間再利用的理論與設計策略。
了解國內外「再利用」案例的規劃操作模式。

description: 在商業空間與視覺形象整合已成為趨勢，透過商業空間和品牌的形象展示，藉由系統化陳列展示與顧客溝通，向顧客傳達室內空間訊息、服務理念和品牌文化，以達到促進商品銷售，進而建立品牌形象為目的。本課程強調“空間與商品視覺化”吸引消費者產生興趣，進而誘導消費達到提高商品銷售的目的！透過本課程的學習，將可讓同學更清楚地瞭解在設計產業中行銷重要性，有別於商業空間設計之視覺形象。
從經濟學的角度看法律的原則，也就是以經濟模型對法律原則作經濟分析，探討是否有效率。上學期主要的內容有：歐美法律簡介、財產經濟學、契約經濟學等。
targets:
知道法律與經濟的差別
理解外部性需要法律的介入
應用公共財理論在法律上

description: 介紹消費者保護法及其他相關消費者保護之法律規定與制度，輔以國內外法院實務與案例分析，並兼及公平交易法、營業秘密法及智慧財產法律中消費者應備之生活法律常識。俾益學生對消費權益與相關法律能有所認識。
targets:
認識消費者保護法及其他相關消費者保護之法律規定與制度
了解企業經營者對消費者所負責任與消費爭議處理程序
說明國內外著名法院實務與案例分析，辨識產品瑕疵、不實廣告、定型化契約等效力與責任，並熟悉如何主張消費者權利。
懂得消費者保護法保護消費者權益之規定，並能實際應用在日常生活與電子商務處理上
具備其他相關消費者保護之知識，能了解並說明消費者保護與民法、刑法、公平交易法、智慧財產權法等之關係，而有助於增進多元視野與社會化技能。
養成正確合理之消費習慣，致力充實消費資訊，提升自我消費生活品質，實踐現代人文素養與社會關懷理念。
textBooks:
消費者保護法
作　　者╱洪誌宏
出版社別╱五南
出版日期╱2023/03/14   (6版 1刷)
I  S  B  N ╱978-626-343-883-5
readings:
綜合小六法  網路資料
報章時事案例

description: 探討智慧財產權相關法制，內容包含智慧財產權概論、商標法、著作權法及專利法，並論及營業秘密保護、不正競爭防止及國際智慧財產權相關問題之探討。
targets:
瞭解智慧財產權之基本法制
熟悉並了解智慧財產權之行使議題
熟悉並了解智慧財產權侵害救濟議題

description: 本課程訓練估價專業技能與分析解釋能力，包括地上權估價、都市更新權利變換估價、容積代金估價三種估價實務，以配合都市計畫擬定或公有財產活化。
targets:
不動產估價理論與方法之應用
各式專業報告書的製作
textBooks: 自編教材(參考不動產估價師公會全聯會各公報及通則與實務案例)

description: 事業創新延續創業入門的課程，進行商品/服務模式/經營模式/新技術運用等相關之創新，與商業模式的建立，課程加入創新價值，完成創造力價值鏈的後端價值（從創業到創新, Entrepreneurship to Innovation, E2I）。學生需完成一份創業計畫書（BP），並進行模擬路演，鼓勵參加校內外的創新創業競賽，進行創業知能之整合。
targets:
協助學生了解新創事業體的建置與發展
介紹工程科學創新如何轉變成商業化的基礎知識
產品設計和創業企劃書製作。

description:
創業與創新是創造財富的新經濟的關鍵推動力。它已成為國家重大重點經濟發展在許多國家，包括台灣在內。例如，以色列，700萬人口的國家聲稱自己是一個“啟動的國家”，在NASDEQ上市多於世界上任何其他國家的63以色列的公司（2009年）。
本課程旨在以講座，論壇，並在體驗動手了豐富的組合，以鼓勵學生將通過創造新的商業的思維過程。學生將被安排在團隊中分享他們的背景，經驗，知識和網絡。
targets:
協助學生了解與培養「創業家精神」
介紹工程科學創新如何轉變成商業化的基礎知識
藉由系統思考的思維協助學生具備解決複雜問題的能力
textBooks: 本課程採用自編講義，講義內容含括創業家精神、創業案例、創意思考等內容。
readings:
MIT創業手冊 https://fcu.ebook.hyread.com.tw/bookDetail.jsp?id=38148
給大學生創業的10項建議：祖克柏的創業心得分享 https://fcu.ebook.hyread.com.tw/bookDetail.jsp?id=39618
一人創業：創業就是，做好一件你真正想做的事！https://reading.udn.com/libnew/Redirect.jsp?T_ID=1424500&U_ID=fcu
精實執行精實創業指南。Ash Mauya著，Eric Ries編，楊仁和譯。碁峯資訊股份有限公司出版。ISBN 978-986-276-718-4
設計思考全攻略。Larry Liefer， Michael Lewrick, Patrick Link著，周宜芳譯。天下雜誌出版。ISBN 978-986-398-430-6
創新與創業管理。張耀文、張榕茜編著。全華圖書出版。ISBN 978-986-503-361-3
Softwares: [{'soft_name': '創新創業需求服務平台\n大專院校創業實戰模擬學習平台', 'soft_memo': '創新創業需求服務平台, https://huzu.stpi.narl.org.tw/index, \xa0, 大專院校創業實戰模擬學習平台, 大專校院創業實戰模擬學習平臺 (moe.gov.tw)'}]

用老師課堂指定方式提交作業，書面資料要使用Microsoft Office/Word、Excel、PowerPoint進行撰寫。
所有討論作業必須在作業的截止日期和時間之前完成，或者必須在到期日之前要求教師給予特殊許可。討論作業的延遲或缺失會影響您的成績。
保留所有作業的備份副本。

integrity:
考評及補考
	應參加考試之學生，未遵守請假或請假未經核准，而未參加考試者，該科該次考試成績以零分計算。
作弊及抄襲
	
違反此規則者，該次評核“不計分”或課程“不計分”。
紙筆測驗時，不得交談、竊窺他人試卷或故意便利鄰座竊窺，或有夾帶、抄襲或傳遞資料等情事經發現時，違者該次考試成績以零分計算；為累犯者則以逢甲大學學生獎懲辦法相關規定處理。
如有替考情事，其舞弊之雙方，均依逢甲大學學生獎懲辦法相關規定處理。
提交原創作品，嚴禁任何形式的抄襲。違反此規則者，該次作業“不計分”或課程“不計分”，結果會導致課程學期成績不及格。


加分及補救措施
	如果您發現學期出現困難時，如跟不上學習進度、聽不懂、或作業有問題等，請您儘早與老師聯繫，以便幫助您找到解決方案。
學期預警
	
當我發現您的學習進度跟不上、可能會妨礙學業成功之疑慮時，我可能會發出預警訊息給您、及您的學習導師。如果您收到預警通知，則您有責任盡快與我聯繫，討論學習上問題，將透過諮詢方式，給予您可能的協助。
另一方面，您也可以多多與您的學習導師聯繫及諮詢，與您面談，一起找尋您的學習障礙點，給予建議改善學習的方案。

description: 透過一對一教學實習，讓學生將華語教學的方法、教學資源和第二語言習得理論、互動經營模式，應用於實際教學中。學生從做中學，紀錄教學日誌，分享教學心得，調整教學成效。
targets:
培養華語教學實務能力
提升師生互動與教學成效
